page.title: 15MOORSHOLM: BUILDINGS
page.content: Spout House is one of the oldest houses, dating from 1695. This was originally single storey but is now 2 storey. Other buildings in the village have been similarly converted. The Church Hall was built in 1864, the Church in 1892 - of local stone. There are two renovated cottages dating from 1762. They are named 'Quaker Cottages' and were used as a Quaker Meeting House with burial ground. A Wesleyan Chapel has been converted into a private dwelling. The Old People's Home, formerly a village school was built in 1876. In the same year two public houses were built, The Plough & The Station Hotel. The former is still open. The Village Memorial Hall was built in 1957 for village activities. 29 new houses have been built since 1957.
